name: Genesis Online
description: Genesis Online! First Person Multiplayer Adventure game in an editable procedural cubic world.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP,7 Processor: Pentium 4 2000MHz Memory: 1024 MB RAM Graphics: GeForce 5700 DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 400 MB available space Sound Card: any
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows XP,7 Processor: Core i5 Memory: 2048 MB RAM Graphics: GeForce 250GTS DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 400 MB available space Sound Card: any

reviews.review_text: This game, if you haven't picked up on the other reviews, is pretty bad. What I understand as the premise of the game is that you're trying to make your house look cool by gathering materials from the biomes.   Aesthetics  - You have decent ambience for the loading screen, and that's the ONLY part of the game you will hear music in. - It felt like the Developers couldn't figure out whether to make the sounds realistic or fictional, but they're pretty bad nontheless. - The HUD(Heads-Up Display) is awful, making the chat box look basic, and the menus look like they're put onto parchment paper, which is a 'no' in my book. - THE PLAYERS.....I still haven't slept. But to be honest here, they look like bobbleheads, only 5 times creepier. - World Design is not that well, and I am considering the scars left by other players.   Pros  - Minecraft for the poor? (Then again, there's Trove)   Cons  - Microtransactions in a building game? Really? - The Biomes NEVER reset (as far as I could tell), so you'll be scrounging for wood. - Your house won't have much space unless you spend real money on the game (Thanks, Microtransactions!).   Conclusion  Unless you feel like playing an obvious clone of Minecraft, don't play this game.
The reviews are better than the actual game.

Pros: The Uninstall Button Works PERFECTLY FINE  Cons:EVERYTHING ELSE Does Not, Players can be #$%&@!'s, Loading Screens=worse then Sonic 06 X100000000000    0/10 - Would Not (And Should Not!) Play Again! If you decide to play for teh lols Look directly at the sky to see some crazy fourth wall shattering stuff ( for me anyway...)

This game took 50 years off of my life, gave me 47 unique forms of cancer, most undiscovered until now, chicken pox, a heart attack, malaria, the black plaque, ebola, whooping cough, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, a stroke, smallpox, all forms of the flu, athlete's foot, the zika virus, chronic weaboo disease, cholera, cavities, arthritis, the common cold (78 and a half times), the measles, tuberculosis, an ear infection, pellagra, scurvy, diabetes, and, worst of all, a ruined kill streak in minecraft CS:GO 10/10 would kill myself again  in all seriousness, this game is a disgrace to the entire human race   EDIT: I didn't even get past the loading screen, but, seeing the videos of this game that have been uploaded to Youtube, I can tell that It's awful.

Captains Log: The Expedition Of Genesis  January, 9th ,2016 Day 1,    An hour and 15 minutes of playing this game is worse than satan himself, it made me realise what i'm grateful for in this world, it enlightened me... it inspired me... it removed all my desires in this world... it made me search inside myself, for anything... anything at all... and satan himself whispered to me... not even i nor God can save you from this endless purgatory known as... Genesis Online... But I Have to thank my friends mostly. they played the game with me for ten minutes trying to embark on this soul searching journey of epic proportions, but alas, they did not have a strong will like I. I searched every corner... of every map... i met three fine fellows (more than i thought would be playing this game), one with sanity, the other two... those poor souls... convinced that this game was good... editing their home worlds... following someone asking them to go mining... god bless them... but the sane one, Hitler, was an experienced pioneer in the darkest areas ofm steam... The Free To Play Games... he was able to keep his sanity after playing quite a bit of these games... i envy him you know?... the ability to go on... without a care... without a purpose... just for fun... i wish i was as smart as he... i contemplated suicide... multiple times in a minute... but there was no noose... nobody came to end my suffering... in the end i gave up... hoping to start the quest again the next day... and this time with success.  ,End Log

Gather round children, it's time for a story.  I asked my dear friend Markus to play this game with me, you know what happend to him? Well, I don't know, I haven't heard from him in 200 years, his Steam status still says 'MarkusMan is playing Genesis Online' I'm pretty sure he might still be waiting on the loading screen, his play time is 175200 hours, and it's still going up to this day. Now I'm sure you're all thinking 'How am I not dead after 200 years' well, kiddies, I've done of few sins (one of them is playing this game) and since I know know from Genesis Online what hell looks like, and if I die I'll have to go to hell, and I don't want to live in Genesis Online for the rest of time.  Update: I went to my friend Markus's place and I found him as a skeleton, and I was right, Genesis Online was still on the loading screen, they did an autopsy on him, and they found out that he died from aids, which is weird since tests showed he was still a virgin, I think I know why. It's cause Genesis Online f*cked him, illumati confermed.  my rating 69/21 would lose a close friend again  P.S. I think I may have aids too, but I still have will to live because I still don't want to live in Genesis Online for the rest of time.

I played the game for about an hour.  *There's no real direction when you first start. I attempted to watch Let's Play videos for the game for direction and found they had the same issue.  *Once you 'Teleport' to the area requested to chop down a tree, you'll find someone has been here before you and has cut most of the wood from the tree. Leaving you with leaves and nowhere does it say, just take down the leaves for the wood you need. *The next quest has you putting a recipe into the furnace with non-specific directions on how to do it. *I was unable to complete that quest and decided that the game was too incomplete for me to play any longer.

+Looks like this could be a very fun game, it does need a lot of work.  +You got the idea right like having a safe place to build, and certain options like mouse sensitivity slider.  -The character heads are horribly big and seems unnecessary. (a brightness slider for the hair color would be helpful)  -For me the loading times for things (jumping from Home to world, World to home, and even opening up the game) seem really slow.  -It overall feels clunky and tedious to navegate the menus and options, making it difficult to figure out what I was doing.  -I noticed I could change my screen resolution, the ratios would change but nothing I did seemed to accually effect my screen size.  -I don't know if you plan to reset the different world servers, but i think it needs to happen on a regular basis, do to the fact that people are messy (each world server could look beautiful) and I had some trouble finding any trees (I only really found the leftover leaves which does count as finding wood, thank goodness).  +Fix some of these basic gaming mechanics and I'll play this game again.
